thread.title: We’re scheduling a hair appointment ASAP because Zoë Kravitz’s new hairstyle is giving us blue heart emoji vibes
thread.title_full: We’re scheduling a hair appointment ASAP because Zoë Kravitz’s new hairstyle is giving us blue heart emoji vibes

author: Amanda Grace
title: We’re scheduling a hair appointment ASAP because Zoë Kravitz’s new hairstyle is giving us blue heart emoji vibes
text:
We’re scheduling a hair appointment ASAP because Zoë Kravitz’s new hairstyle is giving us blue heart emoji vibes Zoë Kravitz will always be the reigning cool kid on the block, so it’s only fitting that she has a new hairstyle to match . The talented triple threat (she models, sings, and acts, we loved her in Mad Max !) took to Instagram to show off her new hairstyle . The Stylist Daniel Moon Ramirez, who is a mastermind of color, is responsible for the star’s platinum locks as well as her new powder blue heart. This dynamic duo is extremely creative, and we can tell the love is genuine.
Don’t let the soft style fool you, though, Zoë Kravitz is one tough woman , who has taken on Hollywood, politics, and cultural injustices . She gives us heart eyes for all the right reasons.
I u @majormoonn 
A photo posted by Zoë Kravitz (@zoeisabellakravitz) on Jan 16, 2017 at 9:59am PST 
The best thing about undercuts? They’re totally hidden if you want to glam it up on the red carpet! We’re loving her look at Elle’ s launch party for the Women in TV issue, featuring our girl Zoë!
Jonathan Leibson / Getty Images The cover girl of Elle Magazine ‘s February 2017 Wome in TV issue posed with her long flowing blonde braids.
"There has to be something positive that can come out of [the election]. Already it's helped me want to connect with everybody. When I go to the deli or I'm talking to a waiter or my Uber driver and they say, "How are you?," I've answered in an honest way for the first time. Like, "Oof." Even that felt good. Let's let everything come to the surface, even with people we come in contact with for a moment. This situation can help us be a little bit more awake with each other." —Zoë Kravitz. The four stars of @hbo's #BigLittleLies are our February cover stars and ELLE's 2017 Women in TV. Click the link in bio to see all the covers. #ELLEWITV || photo by @alexilubomirski, styled by @samiranasr 
A photo posted by Elle Magazine (@elleusa) on Jan 11, 2017 at 6:48am PST 
We love that she is spreading all the love and compassion she can.
She told Elle :
“There has to be something positive that can come out of [the election]. Already it’s helped me want to connect with everybody. When I go to the deli or I’m talking to a waiter or my Uber driver and they say, ‘How are you?,’ I’ve answered in an honest way for the first time. Like, ‘Oof.’ Even that felt good. Let’s let everything come to the surface, even with people we come in contact with for a moment. This situation can help us be a little bit more awake with each other.” We’ll be seeing more of Zoë this year because she’s starring in the upcoming HBO series Big Little Lies alongside Nicole Kidman and Reese Witherspoon.
Some of us wear our hearts on our sleeves, but Zoë is a trailblazer with this hairstyle!
